sen.j: その由縁は、鎌倉時代の建長4年（1252年）、親鸞が愛宕山中の月輪寺よりの帰途、鳴滝で説法をし、それに感銘を受けた里人が、他に何ももてなすものがないので、塩炊きの大根を馳走した。
sen.e: This tradition originated in 1522 during the Kamakura period when Shinran held a sermon in Narutaki on the way back from Getsurinn-ji Temple on Mt. Atago, and the deeply impressed locals presented him with a meal of boiled daikon radish with salt as it was all they had to offer.

sen.j: それに応えて、親鸞はススキの穂を束にして筆代わりとし、「歸命盡十方無礙光如來」の十字名号を書いて、その礼とした。
sen.e: To show his gratitude, Shinran fashioned a brush from bunched zebra grass tips and wrote the ten-character name for the Buddha Amitabha Tathagata; 'Kimyo Jinjippo Mugeko Nyorai' (I take refuge in the Tathagata of unhindered light filling the ten quarters).
